declarations.comments:
Validate all fields in the form, collecting errors

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just F.validateAll ]
```
declarations.title: validateAll

declarations.comments:
Trigger validation on a form field

```purescript
[ HE.onBlur \_ -> Just $ F.validate _name ]
```
declarations.title: validate

declarations.comments:
Submit the form, which will trigger a `Submitted` result if the
form validates successfully.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just F.submit ]
```
declarations.title: submit

declarations.comments:
Provide a record of inputs to overwrite all current inputs without
resetting the form (as `loadForm` does), and then validate the
entire new set of fields. Similar to calling `setValidate` on every
field in the form.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just $ F.setValidateAll
    { name: "Default Name"
    , enabled: false
    }
]
```
declarations.title: setValidateAll

declarations.comments:
Set the input value of a form field at the specified label, also triggering
validation to run on the field.

```purescript
[ HE.onValueInput $ Just <<< F.setValidate _name ]
```
declarations.title: setValidate

declarations.comments:
Provide a record of input fields to overwrite all current
inputs. Unlike `loadForm`, this does not otherwise reset
the form as if it were new. Similar to calling `set` on every
field in the form. Does not run validation.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just $ F.setAll
    { name: "Default Name"
    , enabled: false
    }
]
```
declarations.title: setAll

declarations.comments:
Set the input value of a form field at the specified label.

```purescript
[ HE.onValueInput $ Just <<< F.set _name ]
```
declarations.title: set

declarations.comments:
Reset all fields to their initial values, and reset the form
to its initial pristine state, no touched fields.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just F.resetAll ]
```
declarations.title: resetAll

declarations.comments:
Reset the value of the specified form field to its default value
according to the `Initial` type class.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just $ F.reset _name ]
```
declarations.title: reset

declarations.comments:
Provide a record of input functions to modify all current
inputs, and then validate all fields.  Similar to calling
`modifyValidate` on every field in the form.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just $ F.modifyValidateAll
    { name: \str -> "User: " <> str
    , enabled: \bool -> not bool
    }
]
```
declarations.title: modifyValidateAll

declarations.comments:
Modify the input value of a form field at the specified label, also triggering
validation to run on the field, with the provided function.

```purescript
[ HE.onChange \_ -> Just $ F.modifyValidate _enabled not ]
```
declarations.title: modifyValidate

declarations.comments:
Provide a record of input functions to modify all current
inputs. Similar to calling `modify` on every field in the form.
Does not run validation.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just $ F.modifyAll
    { name: \str -> "User: " <> str
    , enabled: \bool -> not bool
    }
]
```
declarations.title: modifyAll

declarations.comments:
Modify the input value of a form field at the specified label with the
provided function.

```purescript
[ HE.onChange \_ -> Just $ F.modify _enabled not ]
```
declarations.title: modify

declarations.comments:
Load a form from a set of existing inputs. Useful for when you need to mount
Formless, perform some other actions like request data from the server, and
then load an existing set of inputs.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just $ F.loadForm $ F.wrapInputFields
    { name: ""
    , enabled: false
    }
]
```
declarations.title: loadForm

declarations.comments: Inject your own action into the Formless component so it can be used in HTML
declarations.title: injAction

declarations.comments:
Set the input value of a form field at the specified label, while debouncing
validation so that it only runs after the specified amount of time has elapsed
since the last modification. Useful when you need to avoid expensive validation
but do not want to wait for a blur event to validate.

```purescript
[ HE.onValueInput $ Just <<< F.asncSetValidate (Milliseconds 300.0) _name ]
```
declarations.title: asyncSetValidate

declarations.comments:
Modify the input value of a form field at the specified label, while debouncing
validation so that it only runs after the specified amount of time has elapsed
since the last modification. Useful when you need to avoid expensive validation
but do not want to wait for a blur event to validate.

```purescript
[ HE.onChange \_ -> Just $ F.asncModifyValidate (Milliseconds 300.0) _enabled not ]
```
declarations.title: asyncModifyValidate

declarations.comments:
A type class that provides initial values for form fields. While superficially similar to
Haskell's `Default` type class, this class is only meant for the purposes of defining
initial form values. If you need a default value for a field in your form, you are better
off defining it as a `Maybe` field and providing a default as part of validation.

In general, if you find yourself reaching for this type class without defining your form
as a row and generating your form spec from it, then you are probably not doing what you intend.
declarations.title: Initial

declarations.comments:
A convenience function for raising a form's validated and unwrapped outputs
as its only message to a parent component. Useful when you only want to be
notified with a form's successfully-parsed data. For example:

```purescript
type User = { name :: String, email :: Email }

newtype UserForm r f = UserForm (r
  ( name :: f Void String String
  , email :: f EmailError String Email
  ))
derive instance newtypeUserForm :: Newtype (UserForm r f) _

-- we only want to handle our `User` type on successful submission; we can
-- use `raiseResult` as our `handleEvent` function to do this conveniently.
formSpec = F.defaultSpec { handleEvent = raiseResult }

-- the parent can now just handle the `User` output
data ParentAction = HandleForm User

type ChildSlots = ( formless :: F.Slot' UserForm User Unit )
```
declarations.title: raiseResult

declarations.comments:
The default spec, which can be overridden by whatever functions you need
to extend the component. For example:

```purescript
mySpec = F.defaultSpec { render = myRender }
```
declarations.title: defaultSpec

declarations.comments:
The Formless component, which takes a `spec` and provides a running form
component from it.
declarations.title: component

declarations.comments:
A data type which represents the possible output states of the field. Use
the helpers in `Retrieve` to easily manipulate this type.
declarations.title: FormFieldResult

declarations.comments:
Submit the form, returning the output of validation if successful
and `Nothing` otherwise.
declarations.title: submitReply

declarations.comments:
When you have specified a child component within Formless and need to query it,
you can do so in two ways.

First, you can use `H.query` as usual within the `handleExtraQuery` function
you provide to Formless as input. You can, for example, write your own query
which manages the child component, write it into the render function you
supply Formless, and then when that query is triggered, query the child
component.

Second, you can use the `sendQuery` function within your parent component's
`handleAction` or `handleQuery` functions. Given the slot for Formless, the
slot for the child component within Formless, and the query you'd like to
send the child component, `sendQuery` will run through Formless and return
the query result to the parent.

For example, this is how you would query a dropdown component being run
within a Formless form from the parent component.

```purescript
-- in the parent component which mounts Formless
handleAction = case _ of
  SendDropdown (dropdownQuery -> do
    result <- F.sendQuery _formless unit _dropdown 10 dropdownQuery
```
declarations.title: sendQuery

declarations.comments:
Inject your own query into the Formless component. You will need to derive
a `Functor` instance for your query type.

```purescript
data MyQuery a = DoSomething a
derive instance functorMyQuery :: Functor MyQuery
```
declarations.title: injQuery

declarations.comments:
Convert a Formless public action to an action-style query. Any action from
Formless.Action will work, but no others.
declarations.title: asQuery

children.comments: Heterogeneous type class for the getTouchedField function
children.title: getTouchedField

declarations.comments: Data constructor for the getTouchedField function
declarations.title: GetTouchedField

children.comments: Heterogeneous type class for the getResultField function
children.title: getResultField

declarations.comments: Data constructor for the getResultField function
declarations.title: GetResultField

children.comments: Heterogeneous type class for the getOutput function
children.title: getOutput'

declarations.comments: Data constructor for the getOutput function
declarations.title: GetOutput

children.comments: Heterogeneous type class for the getInputField function
children.title: getInputField

declarations.comments: Data constructor for the getInputField function
declarations.title: GetInputField

children.comments: Heterogeneous type class for the getError function
children.title: getErrorResult'

declarations.comments: Data constructor for the getError function
declarations.title: GetError

declarations.comments:
A type representing retrieving all of a particular field with the field's
constructor name. For internal use.
declarations.title: GetAll

declarations.comments: A type representing a lens onto part of a form field
declarations.title: FormFieldLens

declarations.comments:
A type representing a function to produce a value from a record of
form fields given a particular symbol. The result of `view` from
Data.Lens applied with a particular lens to the form.
declarations.title: FormFieldGet

declarations.comments: Get the form as a record where all fields are only the touched value
declarations.title: getTouchedAll

declarations.comments: Given a form, get the touched field at the specified symbol
declarations.title: getTouched

declarations.comments: Get the form as a record where all fields are only the result value
declarations.title: getResultAll

declarations.comments: Given a form, get the result at the specified symbol
declarations.title: getResult

declarations.comments: Get the form as a record where all fields are only the output value
declarations.title: getOutputAll

declarations.comments: Given a form, get the output (if it exists) at the specified symbol
declarations.title: getOutput

declarations.comments: Get the form as a record where all fields are only the input value
declarations.title: getInputAll

declarations.comments: Given a form, get the input at the specified symbol
declarations.title: getInput

declarations.comments: Given a form, get the field at the specified symbol
declarations.title: getField

declarations.comments: Get the form as a record where all fields are only the error value
declarations.title: getErrorAll

declarations.comments: Given a form, get the error (if it exists) at the specified symbol
declarations.title: getError

declarations.comments: A lens to operate on the 'touched' field at a given symbol in your form
declarations.title: _FieldTouched

declarations.comments: A lens to operate on the 'result' field at a given symbol in your form
declarations.title: _FieldResult

declarations.comments:
A traversal to operate on the possible output inside the 'result' field at
a given symbol in your form
declarations.title: _FieldOutput

declarations.comments: A lens to operate on the input at a given symbol in your form
declarations.title: _FieldInput

declarations.comments:
A traversal to operate on the possible error inside the 'result' field at
a given symbol in your form
declarations.title: _FieldError

declarations.comments: A lens to operate on the field at a given symbol in your form
declarations.title: _Field

declarations.comments: Wrap every field in a record with a particular newtype
declarations.title: WrapField

declarations.comments: Unwrap every newtype in a record filled with newtypes
declarations.title: UnwrapField

declarations.comments:
Provided a record, where each field in the record contains
a function from `input -> input`, wraps each function in
the InputField type for compatibility with Formless
declarations.title: wrapInputFunctions

declarations.comments:
Provided a record, where each field in the record contains
a value of type `input`, wraps each value in the InputField
type for compatibility with Formless
declarations.title: wrapInputFields

declarations.comments:
Provided your form type containing a record of only valid outputs
from the result of validation, unwraps the form and every value
in the record to provide a record of only the output values.
declarations.title: unwrapOutputFields

declarations.comments:
A type to collect constraints necessary to apply to prove that a record of
SProxies is compatible with your form type.
declarations.title: SProxies

declarations.comments:
The class that provides the Builder implementation to efficiently
transform a row into a proper InputFields by wrapping it in newtypes and
supplying initial values
declarations.title: MakeInputFieldsFromRow

declarations.comments:
The class used to build up a new record of symbol proxies from an
input row list.
declarations.title: MakeSProxies

declarations.comments:
A helper function to produce a record of SProxies given a form spec, to save
you the boilerplate of writing them all out.
declarations.title: mkSProxies

declarations.comments:
A function to transform a row of labels into a InputFields. This allows you
to go directly from a custom form newtype to an inputs record without having to
fill in any values. Requires that all members have an instance of the
`Initial` type class (all monoidal values do by default, along with some
other primitives).
declarations.title: mkInputFields

declarations.comments: A type to represent validation status
declarations.title: ValidStatus

declarations.comments: The component's public state, as an extensible row
declarations.title: StateRow

declarations.comments: A simple state type when the component does not need extension
declarations.title: State'

declarations.comments: The component local state
declarations.title: State

declarations.comments:
A simplified type when the component has only a form spec, some output, and runs
in some monad `m`
declarations.title: Spec'

declarations.comments:
A type representing the various functions that can be provided to extend
the Formless component. Usually only the `render` function is required,
but you may also provide others. For example, if you have child components,
you can tell Formless how to manage those child components by adding a
handler action and `handleAction` case.
declarations.title: Spec

declarations.comments:
A simple Slot type when the component does not need extension, besides a
custom output message
declarations.title: Slot'

declarations.comments:
A slot type that can be used in the ChildSlots definition for your parent
component
declarations.title: Slot

declarations.comments:
The internals of the public component query type. Many of these are shared
with actions of the same name so they can be used in rendering. See
`Formless.Action` and `Formless.Query` for more.
declarations.title: QueryF

declarations.comments: A simple query type when the component does not need extension
declarations.title: Query'

declarations.comments:
The component query type, which you can freely extend with your own queries
using `injQuery` from `Formless.Query`.
declarations.title: Query

declarations.comments: The component's public state
declarations.title: PublicState

declarations.comments:
A newtype to make easier type errors for end users to
read by hiding internal fields
declarations.title: InternalState

declarations.comments: A simple Input type when the component does not need extension
declarations.title: Input'

declarations.comments:
The component's input type. If you provide `Nothing` as your `initialInputs`
then the form will fill in values based on the `Initial` type class for the
field's input type. Otherwise, the form will contain the values you provide.

Validators can be created using the Formless.Validation module.
declarations.title: Input

declarations.comments: A simple component eval type when the component does not need extension
declarations.title: HalogenM'

declarations.comments: The component's eval type
declarations.title: HalogenM

declarations.comments:
The component tries to require as few messages to be handled as possible. You
can always use the *Reply variants of queries to perform actions and receive
a result out the other end, or extend these messages.
declarations.title: Event

declarations.comments: A type to represent a running debouncer
declarations.title: Debouncer

declarations.comments: A simple component HTML type when the component does not need extension
declarations.title: ComponentHTML'

declarations.comments: The component's HTML type, the result of the render function.
declarations.title: ComponentHTML

declarations.comments: A simple component type when the component does not need extension
declarations.title: Component'

declarations.comments: The component type
declarations.title: Component

declarations.comments:
The component action type. While actions are typically considered
internal to a component, in Formless you write the render function and will
need to be able to use these directly. Many of these are shared with queries
of the same name so they can be used either as queries or as actions. See
`Formless.Action` and `Formless.Query`.

You can freely extend this type with your own actions using `injAction`.
declarations.title: Action

declarations.comments:
A convenience export of formless as a symbol for use when mounting Formless
as a child component

```purescript
type ChildSlots = (formless :: F.Slot' Form FormResult)
HH.slot F._formless unit (F.component spec) input handler
```
declarations.title: _formless

declarations.comments: The row used for the FormField newtype and in lens type signatures
declarations.title: FormFieldRow

declarations.comments: The type that we need to record state across the form
declarations.title: FormField

children.comments: The heterogeneous instance the noValidation function
children.title: emptyValidators

declarations.comments:
A wrapper to represent the validation function on a form field, which can itself take
the form state as its first argument. Inspired in some parts by the Validation type
from purescript-polyform by @paluh.
declarations.title: Validation

children.comments: The heterogeneous instance the noValidation function
children.title: emptyValidators

declarations.comments: The data type used for the noValidation function's heterogenous instance
declarations.title: EmptyValidators

declarations.comments: A more verbose but clearer function for running a validation function on its inputs
declarations.title: runValidation

declarations.comments:
A function to create a record of validators that simply pass through all inputs
for when no validation is needed. Provide this as your `validators` function.
declarations.title: noValidators

declarations.comments:
A validation function which simply passes through its input value as its
output value. Use on individual fields which do not need any validation.
declarations.title: noValidation

declarations.comments: Turn a function from (i -> o) into a proper Validation
declarations.title: hoistFn_

declarations.comments: Turn a function from (i -> m (Either e o)) into a proper Validation
declarations.title: hoistFnME_

declarations.comments: Turn a function from (form Record FormField -> i -> m (Either e o)) into a proper Validation
declarations.title: hoistFnME

declarations.comments: Turn a function from (i -> Either e o) into a proper Validation
declarations.title: hoistFnE_

declarations.comments: Turn a function from (form Record FormField -> i -> Either e o) into a proper Validation
declarations.title: hoistFnE

declarations.comments: Turn a function from (form Record FormField -> i -> o) into a proper Validation
declarations.title: hoistFn

modules.name: Formless
modules.comments:
Formless is a renderless component to help you build forms
in Halogen. This module re-exports all public functions and
types from the library, and can be used as the single import
for most use cases.

```purescript
import Formless as F
```

modules.name: Formless.Action
modules.comments:
This module exports helpers for working with Formless actions, which you
will use in your render function to attach to appropriate fields. Prefer
these over using data constructors from the Formless action type. You can
also freely extend Formless with more actions of your own using `injAction`.

declarations.comments: Inject your own action into the Formless component so it can be used in HTML
declarations.title: injAction

declarations.comments:
Set the input value of a form field at the specified label.

```purescript
[ HE.onValueInput $ Just <<< F.set _name ]
```
declarations.title: set

declarations.comments:
Modify the input value of a form field at the specified label with the
provided function.

```purescript
[ HE.onChange \_ -> Just $ F.modify _enabled not ]
```
declarations.title: modify

declarations.comments:
Trigger validation on a form field

```purescript
[ HE.onBlur \_ -> Just $ F.validate _name ]
```
declarations.title: validate

declarations.comments:
Set the input value of a form field at the specified label, also triggering
validation to run on the field.

```purescript
[ HE.onValueInput $ Just <<< F.setValidate _name ]
```
declarations.title: setValidate

declarations.comments:
Modify the input value of a form field at the specified label, also triggering
validation to run on the field, with the provided function.

```purescript
[ HE.onChange \_ -> Just $ F.modifyValidate _enabled not ]
```
declarations.title: modifyValidate

declarations.comments:
Set the input value of a form field at the specified label, while debouncing
validation so that it only runs after the specified amount of time has elapsed
since the last modification. Useful when you need to avoid expensive validation
but do not want to wait for a blur event to validate.

```purescript
[ HE.onValueInput $ Just <<< F.asncSetValidate (Milliseconds 300.0) _name ]
```
declarations.title: asyncSetValidate

declarations.comments:
Modify the input value of a form field at the specified label, while debouncing
validation so that it only runs after the specified amount of time has elapsed
since the last modification. Useful when you need to avoid expensive validation
but do not want to wait for a blur event to validate.

```purescript
[ HE.onChange \_ -> Just $ F.asncModifyValidate (Milliseconds 300.0) _enabled not ]
```
declarations.title: asyncModifyValidate

declarations.comments:
Reset the value of the specified form field to its default value
according to the `Initial` type class.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just $ F.reset _name ]
```
declarations.title: reset

declarations.comments:
Provide a record of input fields to overwrite all current
inputs. Unlike `loadForm`, this does not otherwise reset
the form as if it were new. Similar to calling `set` on every
field in the form. Does not run validation.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just $ F.setAll
    { name: "Default Name"
    , enabled: false
    }
]
```
declarations.title: setAll

declarations.comments:
Provide a record of input functions to modify all current
inputs. Similar to calling `modify` on every field in the form.
Does not run validation.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just $ F.modifyAll
    { name: \str -> "User: " <> str
    , enabled: \bool -> not bool
    }
]
```
declarations.title: modifyAll

declarations.comments:
Validate all fields in the form, collecting errors

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just F.validateAll ]
```
declarations.title: validateAll

declarations.comments:
Provide a record of inputs to overwrite all current inputs without
resetting the form (as `loadForm` does), and then validate the
entire new set of fields. Similar to calling `setValidate` on every
field in the form.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just $ F.setValidateAll
    { name: "Default Name"
    , enabled: false
    }
]
```
declarations.title: setValidateAll

declarations.comments:
Provide a record of input functions to modify all current
inputs, and then validate all fields.  Similar to calling
`modifyValidate` on every field in the form.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just $ F.modifyValidateAll
    { name: \str -> "User: " <> str
    , enabled: \bool -> not bool
    }
]
```
declarations.title: modifyValidateAll

declarations.comments:
Reset all fields to their initial values, and reset the form
to its initial pristine state, no touched fields.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just F.resetAll ]
```
declarations.title: resetAll

declarations.comments:
Submit the form, which will trigger a `Submitted` result if the
form validates successfully.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just F.submit ]
```
declarations.title: submit

declarations.comments:
Load a form from a set of existing inputs. Useful for when you need to mount
Formless, perform some other actions like request data from the server, and
then load an existing set of inputs.

```purescript
[ HE.onClick \_ -> Just $ F.loadForm $ F.wrapInputFields
    { name: ""
    , enabled: false
    }
]
```
declarations.title: loadForm

declarations.comments:
A type class that provides initial values for form fields. While superficially similar to
Haskell's `Default` type class, this class is only meant for the purposes of defining
initial form values. If you need a default value for a field in your form, you are better
off defining it as a `Maybe` field and providing a default as part of validation.

In general, if you find yourself reaching for this type class without defining your form
as a row and generating your form spec from it, then you are probably not doing what you intend.
declarations.title: Initial

declarations.comments:
The default spec, which can be overridden by whatever functions you need
to extend the component. For example:

```purescript
mySpec = F.defaultSpec { render = myRender }
```
declarations.title: defaultSpec

declarations.comments:
A convenience function for raising a form's validated and unwrapped outputs
as its only message to a parent component. Useful when you only want to be
notified with a form's successfully-parsed data. For example:

```purescript
type User = { name :: String, email :: Email }

newtype UserForm r f = UserForm (r
  ( name :: f Void String String
  , email :: f EmailError String Email
  ))
derive instance newtypeUserForm :: Newtype (UserForm r f) _

-- we only want to handle our `User` type on successful submission; we can
-- use `raiseResult` as our `handleEvent` function to do this conveniently.
formSpec = F.defaultSpec { handleEvent = raiseResult }

-- the parent can now just handle the `User` output
data ParentAction = HandleForm User

type ChildSlots = ( formless :: F.Slot' UserForm User Unit )
```
declarations.title: raiseResult

declarations.comments:
The Formless component, which takes a `spec` and provides a running form
component from it.
declarations.title: component

declarations.comments:
A data type which represents the possible output states of the field. Use
the helpers in `Retrieve` to easily manipulate this type.
declarations.title: FormFieldResult

declarations.comments:
A helper function to debounce actions on the form and form fields. Implemented
to reduce type variables necessary in the `State` type
declarations.title: debounceForm

declarations.comments: Apply a builder that produces an output record from an empty record
declarations.title: fromScratch

declarations.comments: Represents building some output record from an empty record
declarations.title: FromScratch

declarations.comments: A helper function that will count all errors in a record
declarations.title: allTouched

declarations.comments: A helper function that will count all errors in a record
declarations.title: countErrors

declarations.comments:
A helper function that will automatically transform a record of FormField(s) into
just the input value
declarations.title: setFormFieldsTouched

declarations.comments:
A helper function that will automatically transform a record of FormField(s) into
just the input value
declarations.title: formFieldsToInputFields

declarations.comments:
A helper function that will automatically transform a record of FormSpec(s) into
a record of FormField(s).
declarations.title: inputFieldsToFormFields

declarations.comments: An intermediate function that transforms a record of FormField into a record
declarations.title: formFieldsToMaybeOutputFields

declarations.comments:
Given a variant of InputFunction and a record with the same labels but
FormField values, replace the input of the form field. In addition, modify
the form field result to represent whether async validation is going to
occur.
declarations.title: unsafeModifyInputVariant

declarations.comments: The class that provides the Builder implementation to set all form fields touched
declarations.title: SetFormFieldsTouched

declarations.comments:
The class that provides the Builder implementation to efficiently transform the record
of FormField to record of InputField.
declarations.title: FormFieldsToInputFields

declarations.comments:
The class that provides the Builder implementation to efficiently transform the record
of InputField to record of FormField.
declarations.title: InputFieldsToFormFields

declarations.comments:
The class that provides the Builder implementation to efficiently transform the record
of MaybeOutput to a record of OutputField, but only if all fs were successfully
validated.
declarations.title: FormFieldToMaybeOutput

declarations.comments: A class to check if all fs in an FormField record have been touched or not
declarations.title: CountErrors

declarations.comments: A class to check if all fs in an FormField record have been touched or not
declarations.title: AllTouched

declarations.comments: A class that applies the current state to the unwrapped version of every validator
declarations.title: ValidateAll

modules.name: Formless.Query
modules.comments:
This module exports helpers for working with Formless queries. Action-style
queries are already specialized to `Unit` for you. Prefer these over using
data constructors from the Formless query algebra. Remember that you can
freely extend the Formless query algebra with your own queries by using the
`injQuery` function.

declarations.comments:
Inject your own query into the Formless component. You will need to derive
a `Functor` instance for your query type.

```purescript
data MyQuery a = DoSomething a
derive instance functorMyQuery :: Functor MyQuery
```
declarations.title: injQuery

declarations.comments:
Convert a Formless public action to an action-style query. Any action from
Formless.Action will work, but no others.
declarations.title: asQuery

declarations.comments:
Submit the form, returning the output of validation if successful
and `Nothing` otherwise.
declarations.title: submitReply

declarations.comments:
When you have specified a child component within Formless and need to query it,
you can do so in two ways.

First, you can use `H.query` as usual within the `handleExtraQuery` function
you provide to Formless as input. You can, for example, write your own query
which manages the child component, write it into the render function you
supply Formless, and then when that query is triggered, query the child
component.

Second, you can use the `sendQuery` function within your parent component's
`handleAction` or `handleQuery` functions. Given the slot for Formless, the
slot for the child component within Formless, and the query you'd like to
send the child component, `sendQuery` will run through Formless and return
the query result to the parent.

For example, this is how you would query a dropdown component being run
within a Formless form from the parent component.

```purescript
-- in the parent component which mounts Formless
handleAction = case _ of
  SendDropdown (dropdownQuery -> do
    result <- F.sendQuery _formless unit _dropdown 10 dropdownQuery
```
declarations.title: sendQuery

modules.name: Formless.Retrieve
modules.comments: A module with functions for retriving particular fields from a form

declarations.comments: Given a form, get the field at the specified symbol
declarations.title: getField

declarations.comments: Given a form, get the input at the specified symbol
declarations.title: getInput

declarations.comments: Given a form, get the touched field at the specified symbol
declarations.title: getTouched

declarations.comments: Given a form, get the result at the specified symbol
declarations.title: getResult

declarations.comments: Given a form, get the error (if it exists) at the specified symbol
declarations.title: getError

declarations.comments: Given a form, get the output (if it exists) at the specified symbol
declarations.title: getOutput

declarations.comments: Get the form as a record where all fields are only the input value
declarations.title: getInputAll

declarations.comments: Get the form as a record where all fields are only the touched value
declarations.title: getTouchedAll

declarations.comments: Get the form as a record where all fields are only the result value
declarations.title: getResultAll

declarations.comments: Get the form as a record where all fields are only the error value
declarations.title: getErrorAll

declarations.comments: Get the form as a record where all fields are only the output value
declarations.title: getOutputAll

declarations.comments: A lens to operate on the field at a given symbol in your form
declarations.title: _Field

declarations.comments: A lens to operate on the input at a given symbol in your form
declarations.title: _FieldInput

declarations.comments: A lens to operate on the 'touched' field at a given symbol in your form
declarations.title: _FieldTouched

declarations.comments: A lens to operate on the 'result' field at a given symbol in your form
declarations.title: _FieldResult

declarations.comments:
A traversal to operate on the possible error inside the 'result' field at
a given symbol in your form
declarations.title: _FieldError

declarations.comments:
A traversal to operate on the possible output inside the 'result' field at
a given symbol in your form
declarations.title: _FieldOutput

declarations.comments:
A type representing a function to produce a value from a record of
form fields given a particular symbol. The result of `view` from
Data.Lens applied with a particular lens to the form.
declarations.title: FormFieldGet

declarations.comments: A type representing a lens onto part of a form field
declarations.title: FormFieldLens

declarations.comments:
A type representing retrieving all of a particular field with the field's
constructor name. For internal use.
declarations.title: GetAll

children.comments: Heterogeneous type class for the getInputField function
children.title: getInputField

declarations.comments: Data constructor for the getInputField function
declarations.title: GetInputField

children.comments: Heterogeneous type class for the getTouchedField function
children.title: getTouchedField

declarations.comments: Data constructor for the getTouchedField function
declarations.title: GetTouchedField

children.comments: Heterogeneous type class for the getResultField function
children.title: getResultField

declarations.comments: Data constructor for the getResultField function
declarations.title: GetResultField

children.comments: Heterogeneous type class for the getError function
children.title: getErrorResult'

declarations.comments: Data constructor for the getError function
declarations.title: GetError

children.comments: Heterogeneous type class for the getOutput function
children.title: getOutput'

declarations.comments: Data constructor for the getOutput function
declarations.title: GetOutput

declarations.comments: Unwrap every newtype in a record filled with newtypes
declarations.title: UnwrapField

declarations.comments: Wrap every field in a record with a particular newtype
declarations.title: WrapField

declarations.comments:
Provided your form type containing a record of only valid outputs
from the result of validation, unwraps the form and every value
in the record to provide a record of only the output values.
declarations.title: unwrapOutputFields

declarations.comments:
Provided a record, where each field in the record contains
a value of type `input`, wraps each value in the InputField
type for compatibility with Formless
declarations.title: wrapInputFields

declarations.comments:
Provided a record, where each field in the record contains
a function from `input -> input`, wraps each function in
the InputField type for compatibility with Formless
declarations.title: wrapInputFunctions

declarations.comments:
A function to transform a row of labels into a InputFields. This allows you
to go directly from a custom form newtype to an inputs record without having to
fill in any values. Requires that all members have an instance of the
`Initial` type class (all monoidal values do by default, along with some
other primitives).
declarations.title: mkInputFields

declarations.comments:
The class that provides the Builder implementation to efficiently
transform a row into a proper InputFields by wrapping it in newtypes and
supplying initial values
declarations.title: MakeInputFieldsFromRow

declarations.comments:
A type to collect constraints necessary to apply to prove that a record of
SProxies is compatible with your form type.
declarations.title: SProxies

declarations.comments:
A helper function to produce a record of SProxies given a form spec, to save
you the boilerplate of writing them all out.
declarations.title: mkSProxies

declarations.comments:
The class used to build up a new record of symbol proxies from an
input row list.
declarations.title: MakeSProxies

declarations.comments:
A type representing the various functions that can be provided to extend
the Formless component. Usually only the `render` function is required,
but you may also provide others. For example, if you have child components,
you can tell Formless how to manage those child components by adding a
handler action and `handleAction` case.
declarations.title: Spec

declarations.comments:
A simplified type when the component has only a form spec, some output, and runs
in some monad `m`
declarations.title: Spec'

declarations.comments:
The component action type. While actions are typically considered
internal to a component, in Formless you write the render function and will
need to be able to use these directly. Many of these are shared with queries
of the same name so they can be used either as queries or as actions. See
`Formless.Action` and `Formless.Query`.

You can freely extend this type with your own actions using `injAction`.
declarations.title: Action

declarations.comments:
The internals of the public component query type. Many of these are shared
with actions of the same name so they can be used in rendering. See
`Formless.Action` and `Formless.Query` for more.
declarations.title: QueryF

declarations.comments:
The component query type, which you can freely extend with your own queries
using `injQuery` from `Formless.Query`.
declarations.title: Query

declarations.comments: A simple query type when the component does not need extension
declarations.title: Query'

declarations.comments: The component type
declarations.title: Component

declarations.comments: A simple component type when the component does not need extension
declarations.title: Component'

declarations.comments: The component's HTML type, the result of the render function.
declarations.title: ComponentHTML

declarations.comments: A simple component HTML type when the component does not need extension
declarations.title: ComponentHTML'

declarations.comments: The component's eval type
declarations.title: HalogenM

declarations.comments: A simple component eval type when the component does not need extension
declarations.title: HalogenM'

declarations.comments: The component local state
declarations.title: State

declarations.comments: A simple state type when the component does not need extension
declarations.title: State'

declarations.comments: The component's public state
declarations.title: PublicState

declarations.comments: The component's public state, as an extensible row
declarations.title: StateRow

declarations.comments:
A newtype to make easier type errors for end users to
read by hiding internal fields
declarations.title: InternalState

declarations.comments: A type to represent a running debouncer
declarations.title: Debouncer

declarations.comments: A type to represent validation status
declarations.title: ValidStatus

declarations.comments:
The component's input type. If you provide `Nothing` as your `initialInputs`
then the form will fill in values based on the `Initial` type class for the
field's input type. Otherwise, the form will contain the values you provide.

Validators can be created using the Formless.Validation module.
declarations.title: Input

declarations.comments: A simple Input type when the component does not need extension
declarations.title: Input'

declarations.comments:
The component tries to require as few messages to be handled as possible. You
can always use the *Reply variants of queries to perform actions and receive
a result out the other end, or extend these messages.
declarations.title: Event

declarations.comments:
A slot type that can be used in the ChildSlots definition for your parent
component
declarations.title: Slot

declarations.comments:
A simple Slot type when the component does not need extension, besides a
custom output message
declarations.title: Slot'

declarations.comments:
A convenience export of formless as a symbol for use when mounting Formless
as a child component

```purescript
type ChildSlots = (formless :: F.Slot' Form FormResult)
HH.slot F._formless unit (F.component spec) input handler
```
declarations.title: _formless

declarations.comments: The type that we need to record state across the form
declarations.title: FormField

declarations.comments: The row used for the FormField newtype and in lens type signatures
declarations.title: FormFieldRow

children.comments: The heterogeneous instance the noValidation function
children.title: emptyValidators

declarations.comments:
A wrapper to represent the validation function on a form field, which can itself take
the form state as its first argument. Inspired in some parts by the Validation type
from purescript-polyform by @paluh.
declarations.title: Validation

declarations.comments: A more verbose but clearer function for running a validation function on its inputs
declarations.title: runValidation

declarations.comments: Turn a function from (form Record FormField -> i -> o) into a proper Validation
declarations.title: hoistFn

declarations.comments: Turn a function from (i -> o) into a proper Validation
declarations.title: hoistFn_

declarations.comments: Turn a function from (form Record FormField -> i -> Either e o) into a proper Validation
declarations.title: hoistFnE

declarations.comments: Turn a function from (i -> Either e o) into a proper Validation
declarations.title: hoistFnE_

declarations.comments: Turn a function from (form Record FormField -> i -> m (Either e o)) into a proper Validation
declarations.title: hoistFnME

declarations.comments: Turn a function from (i -> m (Either e o)) into a proper Validation
declarations.title: hoistFnME_

declarations.comments:
A function to create a record of validators that simply pass through all inputs
for when no validation is needed. Provide this as your `validators` function.
declarations.title: noValidators

declarations.comments:
A validation function which simply passes through its input value as its
output value. Use on individual fields which do not need any validation.
declarations.title: noValidation

children.comments: The heterogeneous instance the noValidation function
children.title: emptyValidators

declarations.comments: The data type used for the noValidation function's heterogenous instance
declarations.title: EmptyValidators
